revised_title: Effects of Gunshot Injuries on Cerebral Hemispheres and Respiration
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on etherized dogs and physical experiments to understand the effects of gunshot injuries on the cerebral hemispheres and respiration. They found that the primary cause of death is not heart failure but the arrest of respiratory movements. Death can be prevented by artificial respiration, except under specific circumstances. The study also confirms that the respiratory center is the first to be affected by changes in intra-cranial tension.
